sentences.sContent: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light .
sentences.sCn: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.sContent: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine .
sentences.sCn: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.sContent: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.sCn: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.sContent: ...She had no patience for brilliant but irrelevant figures of speech...
...the brilliant historic culture of the Central Avenue can widen people’s vision and enhance their knowledge...
...we should think highly of the importance of basic and fundamental skills that guarantee our wonderful and brilliant future...

synos.tran: 灿烂的，闪耀的；杰出的；有才气的

remMethod.val: brilli(发光) ＋ ant(…的) → 发光的 → 光辉的

trans.tranOther: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong
